case_address_found_1: .5 mi North of the I-494 bridge on the Mississippi River
case_circumstances: The partially decomposed body of an unidentified man was found in the Mississippi River approximately 300 yards north of the I-494 bridge on April 5, 1987.  The body was originally recovered near the Armour Meat Packing Complex in South St. Paul (the Armour plant no longer exists and has been replaced by local businesses).   There was a bible track from Spiritual Life Ministries found in the back pocket of his jeans.  His estimated age is 20-35, with dental records indicating the decedent may be upwards of 40 years old.  The decedent is likely Caucasian or a light-skinned African-American.  The body was in the water for a minimum of 2 weeks to as long as 6 months.
case_facial_hair: Black goatee, may have had a full beard
case_eye_description: The irides appear to be brown but decomposition present makes actual color difficult to discern.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Green nylon jacket, green T-shirt, a light colored shirt, and blue jeans with waist 30-32"
case_other_items_with_body: A bible track from Spiritual Life Ministries was found in the back pocket of his jeans.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
